author: @gomenaros
text: Actually mathematically speaking, percentage change is [(old - new)/old]*100%, while what you 've said is the negative change. It's actually the same thing and a matter of point of view but anyway. Can't wait to watch the other vids !

author: @szev77
text: Hi Sentdex. Was wondering about your explanation regarding the different percentage changes you for talking about. The forward percentage change sounds like a simple return. Don't quite get your reasoning between using the different types. What is the intuition of a reverse percentage change? And what do you mean by a point to point percent change i.e. what is the calculation? in terms of computational complexity, would a log return not be preferable?
